Quality Assurance Home

Standard MIDI File Tests

Note: these files are only for testing purposes only and may not be redistributed.

Render the MIDI files in the following directories:

  • qa/midi/play_4on8 - 4 ascending notes on 8 General MIDI Instruments
  • qa/midi/play_drums - 2 repeated notes on 10 General MIDI Drums

Compare the output sound with the expected instrument sound listed in the General MIDI Instrument Set document. Note that if you compare the sound of these MIDI files with another General MIDI Synthesizer then they will sound different. Please consider that the ME2000 uses a few 100 KB sound set and was designed for low cost embedded processors. In contrast a PC based synthesizer may be using a 3-5 MB sound set and be designed for high performance desktop processors. A keyboard synthesizer may be using an even larger sound set and have dedicated synthesis hardware.

To render the MIDI files, compile the program "examples/play_midifile.c" for your platform.

Or use the pre-compiled DOS executable provided with the SDK and enter in DOS:

render_midifiles qa/midi/play_4on8/*.mid
render_midifiles qa/midi/play_drums/*.mid

Then listen to the resulting WAV files by double clicking on them.
